Developers

The Cupcake Component Library provides front-end developers & engineers a collection of reusable HTML and SCSS partials to build user interfaces.

Getting Started

1. Installation

The suggested way to use Cupcake is with a package manager.

Using npm:

This will pull down the latest version into your local node_modules folder and save it into your projectâs dependencies in package.json.

Note: To use the npm package, you must be authenticated to use Ipreoâs private repo server - artifactory

Read More Here

2. Using the Library

To use the css at the page level - simply include default.min.css in your HTML file:

For more advanced useage you can import the scss:

3. Write your HTML

Using the Cupcake CSS class names and markup

Angular Support

Cupcake has also been extended with many well-designed and implemented components built on top of Angular, one of the most popular JavaScript frameworks in the industry.

You can find some of those in the resources section here. Or by searching on code.ipreo.com.
